title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
question: How is mouse ascites antibody production and purification performed?
answer: The process of mouse ascites antibody production and purification mainly includes the following steps: 1. First, inject fusion tumor cells capable of producing antibodies into the abdomen of mice, and let these cells multiply and secrete antibodies in large numbers in mice. 2. After a period of time, the fusion tumor cells will release a large amount of antibodies into the mouse ascites, forming the so-called "antibody concentration ascites". 3. Next, we will collect the ascites of these mice, which contains a large amount of antibodies. 4. Finally, use purification technology such as FPLC chromatography to recover and purify the antibody to obtain high-quality antibodies for subsequent research. This whole process is an important service item in the human therapeutic antibody development platform to prepare antibodies with potential.

title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
question: What is the principle of X-ray diffractometer?
answer: The principle of X-ray diffractometer is to use accelerated electrons to impact metal targets to generate X-rays, and then analyze samples with periodic lattice structures. By collecting the diffraction angles of different crystal planes, the lattice parameters of the sample can be analyzed, and by analyzing the diffraction intensity of each crystal plane, information on the type and position of atoms in the lattice structure can be obtained. So the combined diffraction pattern of each crystal is unique and, like a human fingerprint, can be used to identify a material as a mineral crystal or as a crystalline material.

title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory

The first one is X-ray room temperature diffractometer, which is used for X-ray diffraction analysis at room temperature; the second one is X-ray variable temperature diffractometer, which has the function of changing temperature. , can conduct research on temperature dependence; the third is a high-resolution X-ray diffractometer, which can provide wide-angle and low-grazing angle diffraction analysis, and is specially used to analyze the microstructure of thin films.
